sentences.english: And they that passed by reviled him, wagging their heads.
sentences.chinese: 从那里经过的人，讥诮他，摇着头说。

sentences.english: Some, however, made fun of them and said, "They have had too much wine. ""
sentences.chinese: 还有人讥诮说，他们无非是新酒灌满了。

sentences.english: Scoffers are with us today, just as Peter warned.
sentences.chinese: 正如彼得警告的那样，今天有好多讥诮我们的人。

sentences.english: He was gifted, on occasion, with a gentle raillery.
sentences.chinese: 他一有机会，总爱说一些温和的讥诮言词。

sentences.english: My friends scorn me: but mine eye poureth out tears unto God.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友讥诮我，我却向神眼泪汪汪。

sentences.english: Others mocking said, These men are full of new wine.
sentences.chinese: 还有人讥诮说，他们无非是新酒灌满了。

sentences.english: In the same way the robbers who were crucified with him also heaped insults on him.
sentences.chinese: 那和他同钉的强盗，也是这样的讥诮他。

sentences.english: Those crucified with him also heaped insults on him.
sentences.chinese: 那和他同钉的人也是讥诮他。

sentences.english: He squinted with a sneering look in the corner of his eye.
sentences.chinese: 他乜斜着眼睛，眼角挂着讥诮的微笑。

sentences.english: What man is like Job, who drinketh up scorning like water?
sentences.chinese: 谁像约伯，喝讥诮如同喝水呢。

definition: to tease/to poke fun at/to make fun of
to sneer/to laugh grimly/grin of dissatisfaction (bitterness, helplessness, indignation etc)/bitter, grim, sarcastic or angry smile
like a smile yet not a smile (idiom)
to disdain to do sth/to think sth not worth doing/to feel it beneath one's dignity
to cast sidelong glances at sb
